column4: likwidL i tried apt install xorg... -intel-dbg but its still no good
root shell looks like dos shell
all my boxes are FreeBSD and they do have a valid xorg.conf in /etc/X11  but on ubuntu the xorg.conf is basically empty
xrandr and it's sibling randr run the show now for video setup.. however it can be overridden by creating an xorg with all the needed stuff
how do you use xrandr in txt mode?
there's lots on the web about that.. i haven't used it enough to remember
